triples.evidence: In image processing, noise can often hide important details.
When we take the two-dimensional Fourier transform of this image, shown in the bottom left, we see its frequency-domain representation.
One simple way is to set the outer regions of the spectrum to zero, while keeping only the frequencies near the center - this is essentially a low-pass filter in the frequency domain.
Finally, applying the inverse Fourier transform gives us the restored image in the top right.
